intro: Dorstenia bicaudata var. quercifolia, commonly known as the "Oak-leafed False Banana," is a unique member of the Musaceae family, though it is not a true banana. This plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that resemble oak leaves, giving it its common name. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. Due to its ornamental value and specific care requirements, it is often cultivated as a rare and exotic houseplant.
